events.name: Betwixt Festival Conversations- Interstice: Art & Technology
events.description:
This month's free Conversations is part of Betwixt Festival
http://2016.betwixtfestival.com/ #betwixtfestivalsg

Saturday, 27 Feb | 10:45am – 2.30pm
Level 4, Expression Gallery
Free. Registration begins 10:00am in the museum lobby, on a first-come, first-served basis.

10.45am- 11.10am: Beyond the Gap – Keynote Lecture by Vibeke Sorensen 
As we look towards the future, where do we go beyond present gaps surrounding art and technology.?

11:15am - 12:30pm: Panel Discussion 1 - Women, Art & Technology-Saturday 27 Feb

Moderator: Honor Harger

Panelists:
Angela Chong
Debbie Ding
Denisa Kera

This panel opens up a dialogue on the institutional gaps in society, technology, economical systems, education, arts and culture.

1.15pm - 2.30pm: Panel Discussion 2 - Digital Art in Southeast Asia- Saturday 27 Feb 

Moderator: Dr Adele Tan

Panelists:
Michelle Ho
Pichaya Suphavanij
Suzy Sulaiman
Dayang Yraola

This panel opens a discussion on curatorial practices, concerns and challenges in digital art, from the perspective of Southeast Asian curators. Where are the interstices of art, culture and digital in Southeast Asia?

Sunday, 28 Feb | 11.00am – 12pm
Level 4, Expression Gallery
Free. Registration begins 10:30am in the museum lobby, on a first-come, first-served basis.

11.00am-11.30am: AFFECT, ART, AND POLITICS 
by Nathaniel Stern
Nathaniel Stern will discuss frameworks for moving-thinking feeling with interactive art, and show, through specific works, how such experiences have us practise and relate anew in our ongoing activities.

11.40 - 12.00pm: Embracing All Sorts Of Gaps As An Artist 
by LIA presented by Spang & Lei
Discover the interstices in art, gender and technology from ananecdotal essay by LIA.

BREAK

1pm -1.15pm: Ping Yi Students’ Talk 
A short presentation of Ping Yi students learning journey from the beginning of the Fun with Art & Bytes Programme to their final art exhibits at the festival.

1.15pm – 2.15pm:Artists Talk
Artists from Open Call selection will discuss about their work in relation to the festival theme ‘Interstice’.

2.30pm – 3pm: Artist Talk & Live Demo by Otto Krause and Milan Loviška with Alwyn Burger and Jason Nel  
 An artist talk and live demonstration of the technology behind the creation of P.P.M. [PUZZLED.PROCESSED.MESHED.]

events.name: Introduction to React.js - Hackerschool
events.description:
Everyone's talking about React.js -- but what exactly is it? 

React.js is a User Interface JavaScript library from Facebook/Instagram, and it completely changes the way front end engineering is done. We'll learn why it's special and how to get started with it.

Workshop is completely free! Remember to sign up @ http://school.nushackers.org/.

Note: Laptop required (Please charge fully before coming as power points are limited)
events.location: Seminar Room 3, Town Plaza (Level 2), University Town, National University of Singapore

events.name: FPV Racing & Big Air!
events.description:
Schedule: 2:30pm - Registration, if you want to compete - get your name on the list now! 3:00pm - Practice Laps, taking it in turns first come first served, get your name on the list and then wait for your turn. 4:00pm - Racing 6:00pm - Results & Free flying (manage your own frequencies) & ... wait for it ... PRIZE Giving!! 


Thats right, the kind folks at 65Drones.com are sponsoring prizes for our event! First Place:  AirBlade One 3k Carbon Fibre frame!  Get yourself into micro-FPV with this stunning micro-hex! https://www.65drones.com/collections/airblade-uav-singapore-malaysia-distributor/products/micro-drone-airblade-one-3k-carbon-fiber-frame Second Place: 2x 1500mAh 4S Batteries.  Upgrade your 3S flying to the power of 4S and you won't go back!  These packs will help you make that switch!  If you're already enjoying 4S, more packs = more flight time!  https://www.65drones.com/collections/65drones/products/65drones-4s-14-8v-45c-continuous-1500mah-battery Third Place: Set of 4x 2204 Motors.  More torque and more power than 1806 and smaller motors, these lightweight motors will keep your quad zooming around the trees!  https://www.65drones.com/collections/motors/products/65drones-2204-motors 



Weather permitting - we're still in rainy season with some wet afternoons, so make sure to check the forecast on the day and look out for comments on the event! Following on the success of our last race gathering, we'll be revisiting the same location - great opportunity to take part if u missed it last time, or improve your time if you made it! Also - worth pointing out the "big race" coming to Singapore on 27 March: http://rpisg.com/futureplay-aerial-race/ This meetup will be the last organised meetup before the race, so get your race practice in with us now!! If you're not going to race - then at least turn up and support your fellow racers - for both events!! :) We'll be setting up a race course and fly in pairs / threes with simultaneous racing starts - and first past the post wins.  It's a little more competitive than the last race, but it'll be easier and more accurate to judge winners this way - and with prizes at stake - there's no room for error! As we'll be racing, please be patient and work with the organisers to keep everything safe and on schedule, that means not flying until it's your turn, being able to switch your transmitter frequency to an assigned channel, and not powering on your quad / transmitter while other's are flying. As always, the following rules apply: 1) Don't switch on your VTx without pre-announcing it to fliers currently in the air and waiting for their confirmation 2) Make sure you know your VTx frequency and are able to adjust it 3) During racing, if you're not currently racing do not switch on at all, until the current race is complete 4) Don't fly beyond your own abilities Read up on FPV etiquette! We're a friendly and encouraging group though, so even if you're a beginner we'll help you to get started. NB - This is a casual meetup and all attendees are responsible for their own safety and liability.  The organiser reserves all rights to determine winners and allocate prizes, and all decisions are final.
events.location: Behind Outram Park MRT, 1A Pearl Bank, Singapore
